screenshare_content: The screen sharing started and then a PowerPoint slide titled "Session 3.5 Genetics and Biochemistry" was displayed. The slide listed three questions related to the role of genetics and biochemical tools in understanding super spreaders and infections.

The screen shared a headshot of William Witola. The headshot remained static throughout the segment.

The screen is shared with a Google Docs document titled "Scilog MZT Meeting Slices". The document contains key points about genetics and biochemistry, including the success of certain bacterial lineages in colonizing different types of hosts, the impact of environmental influences on pathogen adaptations, and the need for tools like single-cell epigenetics or transcriptomics. The document also lists participants and facilitators of the meeting.
A Google Docs document is being shared. The document contains a list of items, possibly notes or agenda points for the meeting. No changes are made to the content during this segment.
The shared Google Docs document is being edited. Kristin moves a bullet point from the bottom of the list to the top. The content of the document remains the same.
